intro: [WRONG START] Lathyrus clymené subsp. articulatus, commonly known as the creeping larkspur, is a perennial herb native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along stream banks. The plant features slender, trailing stems with alternate, pinnately compound leaves. Its flowers are blue to purple, arranged in racemes, and are characteristic of the Fabaceae family. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used historically in traditional herbal medicine.
